page.title: 17Recreation
page.content: Spring comes very early and many of the usual spring flowers are out in so-called mid winter in this area. The walks across the area are superb in natural beauty and are renowned for their peacefulness. Stretching along the coastline are some of the most attractive beaches to be found anywhere on the Island. Each offering a quiet and relaxing area where the natural beauty is all around. Adjoining the Botanic Gardens is Steephill Cricket club and ground set in a sheltered amphitheatre and much higher adjoining Rew Down is Ventnor golf course. Nearer Ventnor is Ventnor Park set out with as little change to nature as necessary to provide terraced walks with marvellous views. The Park also incorporates an 18 hole putting green.
